column5: almost all of my anxiety is like this, very rarely anymore do i get a super crazy panic attack where i hyperventilate. i didn‚Äôt know that an anxiety attack was different, but i get this a lot and it does make it more difficult to explain to others how it feels :(

Damn near all of my anxiety nowadays is physical symptoms, with like no conscious intrusive thoughts. It‚Äôs weird, because sometimes I will get the heart palpitations first, and then start spiraling inside my mind. 

Something that can help at times is if this happens and maybe it‚Äôs night and you‚Äôre laying down in bed, sitting up helps just a little bit... not totally, but there is an improvement. I‚Äôve been getting into meditation more lately and while I do find some quick relief, it‚Äôs not bulletproof (yet). But I have to meditate while sitting up, not lying down. Otherwise I‚Äôll suffer from air hunger until further notice. 

Having an episode of this right now actually, I hope it gets better for you, I really do. To me this is just as bad as a real bad panic attack or depressive episode. Good luck!

This is my biggest challenge with my anxiety (and adhd). The only thing that‚Äôs ever worked is if I just don‚Äôt even think about the steps to doing said thing or something and I just do it without having an intrusive thought in my mind. However it‚Äôs not that easy and this has only worked for me a few times lol, it still needs work. Currently avoiding my taxes and calling my bank rn. Yay!

This is a post that resonates with me especially today, because most of the time my anxiety is all physical, and I won‚Äôt even know what brought it on. For me, it‚Äôs heart palpitations, mainly.. but I get all of them at some point. I had given up on trying to find things to help, but more recently I decided to give meditation another try. It‚Äôs not foolproof for me just yet, and it‚Äôs hard to get myself to do it also due to my ADHD, but it does help some. You are not alone my friend, trust me.

Thanks for the reply! I‚Äôm now almost 2 months in, fatigue has gone away a lot, which is great! Something I‚Äôve noticed that I never had before was the side effect of weight gain.... I am very small so this surprised me. However coupled with a sedentary lifestyle and not eating that great, I should‚Äôve known this would happen. Good news is my depressive episodes have dramatically gone down, so far so good. As long as I don‚Äôt gain any drastic weight or anything changes, I‚Äôll probably stay on this for a little while! I‚Äôd go back to the pill if this didn‚Äôt work, too nervous for an IUD.

Thank you for this. I‚Äôve been going through something similar, and I guess no matter how nice I am some people will still find the need to find something wrong with me. I think it‚Äôs time I stop caring.

This is me!!! Ever since my experience with depo I‚Äôve been terrified, but the pill and now the patch have worked out amazingly for me.

I‚Äôm also prone to migraines (without aura) and I just recently started the patch (xulane) and so far the only noticeable side effect I‚Äôve had is severe fatigue but I‚Äôm hoping that it will subside soon. And I was also on the lowest possible hormonal dose for the pill, so I was SUPER worried that the switch would be rough. But so far it hasn‚Äôt made any existing conditions worse, I would give it a go :) maybe talk to your doctor first about it, and do as much research as possible if you can, before switching!

we create assets with the help of a mentorship team, who you will have access to if you are selected. We work with successful entrepreneurs in the Ecommerce space who can train & coach you.
